snippet: Yangon University, which fell into disrepair during military rule, is being spruced up for President Obama’s visit on Nov. 19.
abstract: Hundreds of workers have descended upon Yangon University in Myanmar to refurbish campus in advance of Pres Obama's visit; visit may highlight deficiencies of country's education system, one of largest roadblocks to development, and may provide extra incentives for authorities to overhaul it.
lead_paragraph: Yangon University, which fell into disrepair during military rule, is being spruced up for President Obama’s visit on Nov. 19.

headline.seo: Obama Visit Brings Hope for Yangon University
headline.main: Burmese University, Awaiting Obama, Patches Over a Long Neglect
headline.print_headline: Burmese University, Awaiting Obama, Patches Over a Long Neglect
